sections.title: Introduction — Goal: Empower GitHub Copilot with MCP servers
sections.summary: Presenter states the goal: enhance GitHub Copilot functionality by using MCP servers and introduces the concept briefly.
key_actions: Explain objective to add MCP servers to GitHub Copilot

sections.title: Current out-of-the-box MCP tools
sections.summary: Shows the default MCP tools available in the environment (only two by default) and references the Visual Studio list of MCP servers.
key_actions: Open Visual Studio MCP servers list

sections.title: Selecting additional servers to add (GitHub and Microsoft Learn/Docs)
sections.summary: Presenter identifies desired servers (GitHub and Microsoft Learn / Microsoft Docs) to add to Copilot and refers to instructions that require creating an MCP config file in the solution root.
key_actions: Decide to add GitHub server configuration
Decide to add Microsoft Learn / Microsoft Docs as a tool source
Follow provided instructions to configure MCP servers
ui_elements: Solution root (target location for MCP config file)

sections.title: Create mcp.json file in solution root
sections.summary: Demonstrates creating a new file named mcp.json in the solution root using Visual Studio (Add New File -> name it mcp.json).

sections.title: Add GitHub server configuration and authenticate
sections.summary: Copies the GitHub server entry into mcp.json, notes the server will be cached but not connected until authentication. Explains Visual Studio will prompt to use local authenticated credentials to connect GitHub and that doing so exposes many GitHub tools to Copilot.
key_actions: Copy GitHub server configuration into mcp.json
Respond to authentication prompt in Visual Studio to connect the server

sections.title: Add Microsoft Docs server and verify tools in Copilot chat
sections.summary: Adds the Microsoft Docs/Microsoft Learn server entry to mcp.json, then opens the Copilot chat (assistant mode) and the Tools panel to verify both the new Microsoft Docs tools and the GitHub Copilot tools are available.
key_actions: Insert Microsoft Docs server configuration into mcp.json
Save file and allow any necessary connection/authentication
Open GitHub Copilot chat in assistant mode
Open Tools panel to confirm the new Microsoft Docs and GitHub tools are present
ui_elements: mcp.json file (content: Microsoft Docs server entry)
Tools panel (inside Copilot chat) showing available tools

main_topics: Authentication via Visual Studio local credentials
Verifying tools in Copilot chat tools panel
